candidates.definition: The mechanical system that slows or stops a vehicle using friction components and hydraulic controls.

positive_examples: The mechanic inspected the entire brake system including the pads and rotors.
Her car's brake system failed on the steep mountain road.
Modern brake systems use hydraulic pressure to activate the calipers.
The brake system warning light came on during my commute.
Racing cars require high-performance brake systems for quick stops.
The brake system overheated after repeated hard braking.
negative_examples: The steering system needs alignment after the accident.
He engaged the parking brake before getting out.
The engine braking helped slow the truck down the hill.
The transmission system shifts gears automatically.
Wind resistance acts as a natural brake at high speeds.
The suspension system absorbs road bumps effectively.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SteeringSystem, TransmissionSystem, SuspensionSystem, EngineSystem

candidates.definition: mechanical components that transmit power from engine to wheels in vehicles

positive_examples: The mechanic replaced the worn clutch in my transmission system
Ball bearings in the wheel hub need regular lubrication
The drive belt connects the engine crankshaft to the alternator
Front axle damage requires immediate repair for safe driving
Her car's drivetrain components were making grinding noises
The all-wheel drive system distributes power through multiple axles
negative_examples: The engine block cracked and needs replacement
Dashboard warning lights indicate electrical problems
Air conditioning system requires refrigerant refill
Brake pads are worn and need immediate replacement
The car's suspension system handles road bumps well
Headlight bulbs burned out during the storm
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: EngineComponents, BrakingSystem, ElectricalSystems, SuspensionParts

candidates.definition: Internal mechanical parts that enable engine operation and power generation in vehicles.

positive_examples: The mechanic replaced the worn rocker arm to fix the valve timing issue.
After cleaning the distributor cap, the car started running much smoother.
The exhaust manifold was glowing red hot after the long uphill drive.
She adjusted the choke to help the cold engine start on the winter morning.
The connecting rod bearing failed, causing a loud knocking sound in the engine.
The fuel atomizer spray pattern was optimized for better combustion efficiency.
negative_examples: The transmission slipped when shifting into third gear.
He checked the brake pads for wear during the routine inspection.
The steering wheel vibrated at highway speeds due to alignment issues.
She replaced the worn tires before the long road trip.
The air conditioning compressor needed refrigerant to cool properly.
The headlight bulb burned out and needed replacement.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TransmissionComponents, BrakingSystem, ElectricalSystems, SuspensionParts, ExteriorComponents

candidates.definition: Small automotive parts and accessories used for vehicle maintenance, repair, or operation

positive_examples: The mechanic replaced the worn gasket to stop the oil leak
He pressed the gas pedal to accelerate up the hill
The muffler was damaged and making the car extremely loud
We used jumper cables to start the dead battery
Regular greasing through the fitting keeps the joint lubricated
She found the replacement gasket in the auto parts store
negative_examples: The engine block cracked and needed major repair
The transmission was slipping in third gear
The brake system required a complete overhaul
The car's computer diagnosed the fuel injection problem
The suspension components were worn and bouncy
The electrical wiring harness was damaged in the accident
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: VehicleEngine, VehicleElectrical, VehicleBrakes, VehicleTransmission

candidates.definition: Components and accessories directly associated with vehicle wheels and tires for function, maintenance, or safety.

positive_examples: The mechanic used a tire changer to mount the new tires on the rims.
We put tire chains on our car before driving through the snowy mountains.
The brake pads were worn down to the metal backing plate.
Place wheel chocks behind the rear tires before jacking up the car.
The alloy wheel rim was cracked and needed replacement.
The tire shop replaced the worn brake shoe lining.
negative_examples: The car's engine was making a strange rattling noise.
She adjusted the side mirrors before backing out of the driveway.
The transmission fluid was leaking onto the garage floor.
The headlights were too dim and needed new bulbs.
The steering wheel was vibrating at highway speeds.
The air conditioning system needed a refrigerant recharge.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: EngineComponent, TransmissionPart, BrakingSystem, SteeringMechanism, ElectricalSystem
